The chunk introduces the Panda3D documentation, explaining its purpose as a comprehensive guide for using the 3D engine with Python or C++, and outlines the two versions of the manual available. It also briefly mentions the structure of the document and directs readers to use the sidebar for navigation.

Panda3D Manual

Welcome to the Panda3D documentation! Panda3D is an open-source, free-to-use 3D engine made for the development of realtime 3D games, visualizations, simulations, experiments — you name it! It consists of a library of subroutines that can be used with either the Python or C++ programming language, as well as a few tools to assist with development and debugging.

python

There are two versions of the manual: one for Python users and one for C++ users. Use the link in the sidebar to switch between the versions. You are currently viewing the manual for Python users.

cpp

There are two versions of the manual: one for Python users and one for C++ users. Use the link in the sidebar to switch between the versions. You are currently viewing the manual for C++ users.

The manual is divided up into sections, which are listed below. You can at any time use the sidebar on the left side to navigate between the different sections and their contained pages.
